data.title: How Airtable Competes With Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets
data.text: Spreadsheet startup Airtable has closed a funding round of $185 Million.

data.title: Google faces $3.2 billion lawsuit over use of children's data in U.K.
data.text: Alphabet Inc.'s Google GOOGL, -0.45% GOOG, -0.09% faces a $3.2 billion lawsuit on behalf of more than five million British children under 13 and their parents over claims that YouTube routinely breaks privacy laws by tracking children online.

data.title: Google Launches Its Answer To TikTok: YouTube Shorts
data.text: As TikTok faces bans in many countries and a pending sale in the U.S., companies are launching short-form video content to compete.

data.title: YouTube Fills Void Left by India's Ban of TikTok With New "Shorts"

data.title: YouTube Launches TikTok Clone ‘YouTube Shorts’ Starting With India
data.text: Like TikTok, YouTube Shorts allows users to upload up to 15-second-long videos.

data.title: Google will announce a new Pixel, smart speaker and Chromecast September 30
data.text: Hardware season is in full swing. Apple’s big Watch event kicks off tomorrow and Samsung is readying itself for a third (!) Unpacked event on September 23.

data.title: YouTube is adding a new Shorts format to rival TikTok, Instagram Reels
data.text: The new format will be available in India to start.

data.title: YouTube unveils short-form video ‘Shorts’ to compete with TikTok
data.text: YouTube is rolling out a short-form video feature called "YouTube Shorts" to compete with the popular social media platform TikTok.

data.title: Alphabet's YouTube to launch TikTok-like product
data.text: Alphabet Inc's YouTube is rolling out its version of social media rival TikTok, a new short-form video service called Shorts, enabled within its video-sharing platform.

data.title: YouTube announces TikTok competitor in India, where TikTok is banned
data.text: YouTube on Monday unveiled Shorts, a short-form video feature that's aiming to directly compete with TikTok.

data.title: YouTube announces its own TikTok competitor
data.text: YouTube's own TikTok copycat is here.

data.title: YouTube Debuts Shorts, A New Venue For Mobile Videos A Few Seconds Long
data.text: YouTube has rolled out Shorts, a new offering focused on mobile videos lasting no longer than 15 seconds. The explosive growth of TikTok over the past year has gotten the tech world’s full attention. Instagram just launched Reels, a rival offering, in the U.S. TikTok, whose U.S. operations are due to be overseen by Oracle

data.title: YouTube launches its TikTok rival, YouTube Shorts, initially in India
data.text: As TikTok’s fate in the U.S. remains murky, YouTube today announced the launch of a new short-form video experience it’s calling YouTube Shorts.

data.title: YouTube hit with UK class action style suit seeking $3BN+ for ‘unlawful’ use of kids’ data
data.text: Another class action style lawsuit has been lodged against a tech giant in the UK alleging violations of privacy and seeking major damages. The latest representative action, filed against Google-owned YouTube, accuses the platform of routinely breaking UK and European data protection laws by unlawfully targeting up to five million under-13-year-olds with addictive programming and […]

data.title: Google aims to run on carbon-free energy by 2030
data.text: Alphabet's Google aims to power its data centers and offices 24-7 using solely carbon-free electricity by 2030, its chief executive told Reuters, building on its previous goal of matching its energy use with 100% renewable energy.

data.title: Google claims net zero carbon footprint over its entire lifetime, aims to only use carbon-free energy by 2030
data.text: Google was at the leading edge of large technology companies seeking to go completely carbon neutral, having declared that status in 2007, and subsequently matching all of its global electricity consumption with renewable energy. Now, the company says that it is breaking new ground by becoming the first major company to effectively eliminate its entire […]

data.title: Google sets unprecedented goal to tap only renewable power by 2030
data.text: Alphabet Inc's Google aims to power its data centers and offices solely with renewable energy by 2030, its chief executive told Reuters, becoming the biggest company in the world to commit to ditching coal and natural gas power.

data.title: Hausfeld & Co LLP: Google Facing Landmark UK Court Claim Over Unlawful Use of More Than 5 Million Children’s Data
data.text: LONDON--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Multibillion-pound lawsuit aims to force YouTube to stop tracking children under 13 and to compensate millions of underage users and families in UK
